oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of Harold Hanson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Real picture postcard, half-portrait, of Private Harold Hanson in uniform. His right epaulet bears the shoulder title of the British army's West Yorkshire Regiment (14th Foot). The sepia studio portrait is of an earnest looking young man. Writen above is "Uncle Harold." Hanson was born in Wyke, West Yorkshire, and was killed in France on Oct. 7, 1918, a little over a month before the Armistice. The West Yorks won more than 200 battle honors during the Great War. The regimental buttons displayed a tiger.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Hanson, Harold
